meanings.definition: Resembling a small lobe or lobule.
meanings.sent1: The lobular growth on the plant was tiny and round.
meanings.sent2: The lobular structure of the tissue made it easy to identify.
meanings.sent3: The lobular pattern on the fabric looked like a cute design.
meanings.sent4: Her lobular earrings dangled delicately like little lobes.
meanings.sent5: The lobular shape of the cloud resembled a fluffy pillow.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or relating to lobules.
meanings.sent1: The lobular glands in the body play an important role.
meanings.sent2: The lobular arrangement of the cells was clearly visible.
meanings.sent3: The lobular cupcakes were a hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: His lobular thoughts branched out into various ideas.
meanings.sent5: The lobular structure of the beehive fascinated the children.

meanings.definition: Divided into or having lobes or lobules.
meanings.sent1: The lobular leaf had distinct sections along its edges.
meanings.sent2: The lobular design of the necklace gave it an elegant look.
meanings.sent3: The lobular pizza was cut into perfect slices.
meanings.sent4: Her lobular heart felt both joy and sadness at once.
meanings.sent5: The lobular terrain of the mountain made it challenging to climb.
